SourceProxy.name: CellGridSource
SourceProxy.label: Cell Grid Source

Documentation.long_help: Create a cell grid with one type of cell.
Documentation.short_help: Create a cell grid with one type of cell.

SourceProxy.Documentation: This source creates a cell grid populated with a single cell of the specified type. If the cell's type uses a reference-element formulation, the cell should have an identity map from reference space to world-coordinates space.

StringVectorProperty.name: CellType
StringVectorProperty.label: Cell Type
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: The type of cell to insert into the generated cell grid.

SourceProxy.name: ComputeCellGridSides
SourceProxy.label: Compute Sides

Documentation.long_help: Compute external-facing sides of conforming cells.
Documentation.short_help: Compute external-facing sides of conforming cells.

SourceProxy.Documentation: This filter adds arrays (if not already present) holding tuples of (cell ID, side ID) pairs which identify the sides of all the cells which do not share a boundary with a neighbor (i.e., any external surfaces as well as non-conforming internal surfaces). These arrays are grouped by the type of cells whose sides they refer to as well as the shape of the side. (For example, a group of wedge cells will have one array listing quadrilateral sides and another array listing triangular sides.) These arrays can be used to render the cell grid efficiently.

IntVectorProperty.name: PreserveRenderableInputs
IntVectorProperty.Documentation:
Set this property to true to include the original input cells in the output if they are of dimension 2 or lower (i.e., surface, edges, or vertices). If false, then only the computed sides will be output.
As an example, if an input has hexahedra and triangle cells, this filter will output quadrilateral sides and triangle cells when PreserveRenderableInputs is true and only quadrilateral sides when PreserveRenderableInputs is false.

IntVectorProperty.name: OmitSidesForRenderableInputs
IntVectorProperty.Documentation:
Set this property to true to avoid generating sides for input cells or sides that can be rendered as they are. If false, then sides will be output even for cells/sides that are surfaces or edges.
As an example, if an input has hexahedra and triangle cells, this filter will generate quadrilateral sides (for the hexahedra) and edge sides (for the triangles) if OmitSidesForRenderableInputs is true, but only quadrilateral sides (for the hexahedra) if OmitSidesForRenderableInputs is false. Note that this is independent of whether some input cells are preserved or not.

IntVectorProperty.name: OutputDimensionControl
IntVectorProperty.label: Sides to Include
IntVectorProperty.Documentation:
Set this property to true to include the original input cells in the output if they are of dimension 2 or lower (i.e., surface, edges, or vertices). If false, then only the computed sides will be output.
As an example, if an input has hexahedra and triangle cells, this filter will output quadrilateral sides and triangle cells when PreserveRenderableInputs is true and only quadrilateral sides when PreserveRenderableInputs is false.

SourceProxy.label: Convert To Cell Grid
SourceProxy.name: ConvertToCellGrid

Documentation.long_help: Convert unstructured grids into cell grids.
Documentation.short_help: Convert unstructured grids into cell grids.

SourceProxy.Documentation:
This filter turns an unstructured grid or partitioned dataset collection whose leaf nodes are unstructured grids with linear cells into a partitioned dataset collection of cell grids.
Additionally, it uses annotations added to the field data by the IOSS reader to promote certain cell-data arrays into spatially-varying discontinuous Galerkin attributes.
Note that even unstructured grids with no annotations are converted into cell grids so that the entire dataset can be rendered using the composite cell-grid representation.

SourceProxy.name: ComputeCellGridElevation
SourceProxy.label: CellGrid Elevation

Documentation.long_help: Add a new attribute representing elevation.
Documentation.short_help: Add a new attribute representing elevation.

SourceProxy.Documentation: This filter adds a cell-attribute named Elevation that represents the distance from either (1) a point, (2) a line, or (3) a plane.

StringVectorProperty.name: AttributeName
StringVectorProperty.label: Attribute Name
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: The name of the output attribute added to the mesh.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Shock
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: An offset to add to the elevation. Non-zero values create discontinuities.

IntVectorProperty.name: NumberOfAxes
IntVectorProperty.label: Distance Type
IntVectorProperty.Documentation:
Set how distance is measured.
planar/linear: elevation is measured by projecting any test point to the input Axis, then computing the distance to the Origin.
cylindrical: elevation is measured from the nearest point along the line passing through the Origin along the Axis. All points along line have an elevation of 0.
spherical: elevation is measured using the LÂ² norm of the vector from the Origin to each test point. The Axis is ignored.

SourceProxy.name: CellGridPointProbe
SourceProxy.label: CellGrid Probe

Documentation.long_help: Sample input polydata points with a cell grid.
Documentation.short_help: Sample input polydata points with a cell grid.

SourceProxy.Documentation: This filter copies the input polydata and adds information about how its points are related to cells of an input cell grid.

InputProperty.name: Input
InputProperty.Documentation: An input polydata to use as a probe.

InputProperty.name: Source
InputProperty.Documentation: An input cell grid to probe.

StringVectorProperty.name: CellGridAttribute
StringVectorProperty.label: CellGrid Attribute
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: This property chooses a cell-grid attribute to sample.

SourceProxy.name: CellGridCenters
SourceProxy.label: CellGrid Centers

Documentation.long_help: Create a vertex at each cell center.
Documentation.short_help: Create a vertex at each cell center.

SourceProxy.Documentation: This filter adds a vertex cell at the center of each input cell. The output will have all of the attributes defined on the cell interpolated to the output vertices.

SourceProxy.name: CellGridToUnstructuredGrid
SourceProxy.label: Cell Grid To Unstructured Grid

Documentation.long_help: Convert a cell grid to an unstructured grid.
Documentation.short_help: Convert a cell grid to an unstructured grid.

SourceProxy.Documentation: This filter approximates a cell grid with an unstructured grid whose cells are linear approximations to cells in the cell grid. All higher-order information is discarded. All fields on the cell grid are converted into point-data on the unstructured grid; since points are shared by neighboring cells, the values at points are averaged across all cells incident to the point. Thus discontinuities at cell boundaries are eliminated by averaging.

SourceProxy.name: CellGridTransform
SourceProxy.label: Cell Grid Transform

Documentation.long_help: Apply a geometric transform to a cell grid.
Documentation.short_help: Apply a geometric transform to a cell grid.

SourceProxy.Documentation: This filter allows you to translate, rotate, and scale cell-grid data.

ProxyProperty.name: Transform
ProxyProperty.Documentation: The values in this property allow you to specify the transform (translation, rotation, and scaling) to apply to the input dataset.

SourceProxy.name: CellGridWarp
SourceProxy.label: Cell Grid Warp

Documentation.long_help: Deform a cell-grid's shape by a vector-valued cell-attribute.
Documentation.short_help: Deform a cell-grid's shape by a vector-valued cell-attribute.

SourceProxy.Documentation: This filter allows you to deform a cell grid. Responders currently require interpolation schemes for the shape and deformation attribute to match.

StringVectorProperty.name: DeformationAttribute
StringVectorProperty.label: Deformation Attribute
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: This property chooses a cell-grid attribute to use for warping.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: DeformationScale
DoubleVectorProperty.label: Deformation Scale

Documentation.short_help: Set a scale factor to apply to the deformation.
Documentation.long_help: Set a scale factor to apply to the deformation.

DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: Set a scale factor to apply to the deformation.
